alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 4:15PM EDT until August 04 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN RUTLAND AND WEST CENTRAL WINDSOR COUNTIES... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rutland, Mendon, Rutland City, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Shrewsbury, Clarendon, Killington, Proctor, Chittenden, West Rutland, Pittsford, Wallingford, Ira, Pittsfield, Plymouth, Stockbridge, Tinmouth, Bridgewater, Middletown Springs and Castleton. Stratton Rd, South Main St, Clover St and West St in Rutland city are closed due to flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
